short_summary: Request for Proposal for Enhanced Sockeye Fry Rearing at Tatsamenie Lake
description: This procurement opportunity concerns the receipt and rearing of sockeye salmon fry for release to the wild at Tatsamenie Lake. It is expected that the contractor will receive sockeye salmon fry to be reared in the field from May 25 to June 30. The contractor will be selected on the basis of the competition, and the contract period is expected to be from January 31, 2024 to April 30, 2025.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Solicitation Details

* **Reference Number**: cb-405-19318410
* **Solicitation Number**: 30004837/A
* **Publication Date**: 2023-12-20
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-01-15T13:00:00 (Exceeded)
* **Tender Status**: Expired

## Project Overview

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada is seeking a contractor to conduct Enhanced Sockeye Fry Rearing at Tatsamenie Lake, British Columbia. The project involves transporting fry to the lake, rearing them to target sizes, and releasing them back into the wild. This initiative aims to evaluate the success of the project using different strategies.

## Objective

Beginning in Spring 2024, the contractor will receive transported fry and conduct rearing of approximately 200,000 to 400,000 sockeye fry according to directions annually determined by the Transboundary Technical Committee and Enhancement Sub-committee. The project involves risks associated with disease and predation, and the contractor must ensure monitoring and prevention measures to ensure optimal project success.

## Scope of Work

The contractor will coordinate all aspects of the project, including equipment mobilization, maintenance, and deployment. The project objectives include:

* Transportation of fry to Tatsamenie Lake (approx. May 25th and June 5th)
* Rearing fry to target sizes (approx. May 25th to June 30th)
* Installation and maintenance of a fish net and continuous monitoring of the smolt mark recapture program
* Regular sampling of reared fry for size and body condition
* Evaluation of reared fry for signs and symptoms of disease
* Sampling of smolts captured during the enumeration project for length, weight, and lethally subsampling as necessary

## Trade Agreements and Security Requirements

This requirement is subject to the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). There are no security requirements related to this solicitation.

The period of the Contract is from the date of Contract Award to April 30, 2025, inclusive. The Contractor grants to Canada the irrevocable option to extend the term of the Contract by up to three (3) additional one (
